revised_title: Quantum Theory of Atomic Polarization and Van der Waals Energy
tldr: The authors develop a quantum theory to calculate the van der Waals energy of two atoms. They use the concept of atomic polarization and polarizability to determine the energy of interaction between atoms at a large distance apart. The study provides a relation between the van der Waals constant and the polarizabilities of the two atoms, which can be used to estimate the van der Waals energy in various atomic systems.
